alert.note: Alert for Garden; Keith (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 10 at 12:00AM CST until further notice by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in North Platte has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Nebraska... North Platte River at Lewellen affecting Keith and Garden Counties. For the North Platte River...including Lewellen...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...North Platte River at Lewellen. * WHEN...From this evening until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Moderate flood stage. Flooding may occur around Fairground Street, County Road 46, County Road 199 A and County Road 44 A east of Highway 26. Homes near and along the river may begin to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:45 PM MST Friday the stage was 8.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:45 PM MST Friday was 8.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 8.6 feet late this evening. It will then fall below flood stage early Monday morning. - Action stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Saturday morning at 1100 AM MST.
